I am now the proud owner of a brand new CO detector. 

(As installed due to apartment maintenance.)

@BenNewbon It just feels so... weird. Like you don't want to know anything about me? I'm a perfect stranger. And I don't even know how to flirt so it just puts me in an awkward position of like... yeah, hi, sure...

I mean, I didn't actually say that. But that's what I thought. I had no response to that. Like I guess it's supposed to be cute and flirty but for me it's just weird. 

Like I guess some people go to dating apps with the intention of immediate intimacy with strangers but... nah.

I was mentioning how I was waiting for someone to come do fire safety maintenance in my apartment today and the person was like "too bad you can't come cuddle with me instead" or something like that. 

And I was just like... I don't know you.

Dating apps have me learning what I like and don't like. I don't like when people are overly forward. I would rather chat first about hobbies and life and stuff. Flirting with me right out the gate freaks me out. I don't know how to respond to that. It makes me feel weird. Huh.
@NevernotDM A golden spork. No really, it's made of solid gold.
@EzmereldaDAveni -takes notes for her Curse of Strahd game- 😉

I did some dishes, started to feel dizzy, said I'd sit down and do more dishes in a little bit. 

It's been a little bit and do I have any motivation to do more dishes? 

No, I do not.

@arenthedroids4u That's usually the case with me too. As evidenced by the really scary dishes I'm dealing with from a misguided idea to "just let them soak overnight". 

It was not overnight.

Me: [makes a thread about the reality of ADHD and the consequences of chores left undone]

Also me: [deletes it because of embarrassment]
@ZiziFothSi -throws out ADHD meds- Good thing I don't need these anymore at my old age of 26.

I've never exchanged numbers with anyone on a dating app, as friends or otherwise. As someone who doesn't really make friends or connections well, this just feels like a little milestone for me. That someone enjoys talking to me enough they want to make sure they see my messages.

Also I'm just lowkey tweeting this as a no big deal thing but I've been on a dating app recently and I exchanged numbers with someone yesterday and... excite!

Neither of us are dating or anything, we just wanted to move off the app so we could chat more and see where things go.

@RRollplaying Okay, this one I laughed out loud.

Gremlin brain: You should play World of Warcraft.

Gremlin brain: But you wanna know what the hype is about.
@StillDormant @QueenofCrit @GeeksPaid @DarthSolock I spent yesterday explaining D&D to someone I just met so like... I think there might be, but if there is, I'm not interested.

@kristin__house Exactly that! And no shame at taking it at your own pace and needing breaks from people if you're not up for it. Sometimes we just need a rest. Taking steps back doesn't mean we need to regain them all in one go.
I certainly picked the longest (15 book) series I could find.

It occurs to me that Wheel of Time is my first adult fantasy series. I didn't read LOTR (which is only three books + The Hobbit) and I've never read Game of Thrones or anything like it.

I've never really strayed outside of YA fiction. Not that there's anything wrong with that.
@kristin__house You have my sympathy. I dunno why, my social anxiety has been acting up a lot lately as well. But nothing to do but try and face it, I suppose!

@alisterscriven I think any series that goes on for a long time goes downhill after a certain point for everyone. Each person thinks a certain point would have been the best place to end it or that characters had their resolution. But I'll have to see as I go along.

@alisterscriven I have all of them but it'll probably take me like a year to read them. That said, I read 14 chapters yesterday so depending on the day, I might be on a roll. I want to read the whole series (it would be my first big fantasy series) so we'll see!

@alisterscriven My only complaint, if anything, is that perhaps Rand is not the most interesting character in the world. But that's also pretty typical of the genre where "ordinary farmhand gets thrust into a giant adventure he never expected" and doesn't have anything special about him.

@alisterscriven So like if that's how Rand, a male character sees them, then I do have hope for how they're written on their own. If the worst is that they just don't sound overly feminine or necessarily have a distinct voice from the men, then that's hardly my worst complaint. I like it so far.

@alisterscriven I've also noticed, as written, at least from Rand's perspective, Moiraine and Egwene do seem to be fairly multifaceted. Both have more than one personality trait, both get treated like autonomous characters in their own right rather than simply side characters.

@alisterscriven Like there are some authors who write women SUPER badly (like stereotype badly). But when it just comes to their voices sounding a bit like "one of the guys", I mean, it could be worse. My male characters somehow always sound a bit like "one of the girls." It's just how I write.

@alisterscriven And to be perfectly fair to Robert Jordan and other male authors, I don't exactly blame them. I mean, I try to write male perspectives in my own writing and they come out sounding the same as my female characters so... 🤷🏻‍♀️ Maybe I'm the reverse of 80s/90s male fantasy authors.

@alisterscriven I kind of expect, when it comes to series like these, for most of the women to have one defining trait and to otherwise be written like a man. I use my imagination to fill in the rest. Doesn't make it a bad read. Just different. I'm glad I'll see more from them though.

@alisterscriven I mean, I do expect that. Whenever I see a fantasy series with predominant female characters written by a man, I expect them to be... so-so. It's a style of writing I can handle because it just... exists, lmao. Moiraine seems to be intriguing enough though! Egwene seems bold too.

@alisterscriven OH GOOD. I thought that might happen because I did read some minor spoilers (and know from the show) and it seemed like it would be impossible to do well without splitting the POVs up. I just miss some of the things they showed in the TV show because of the focus on Rand.

I think part of it is also jarring because I came from the show where a lot more emphasis was put on the women's perspectives. Don't get me wrong, Moiraine plays a big role and Egwene seems like she'll play a bigger role in future books, but Egwene had a larger role in the show.

I've always preferred reading books from the perspective of girls and women. It's not that I can't read a book from a male perspective. I just don't prefer it is all. And a lot of older fantasy is written from the male perspective. I expected it. Doesn't mean I can't wish though.

My new obsession is gonna be Wheel of Time, I know it. I kinda wish the book wasnt written solely from Rand's perspective so because, let's face it, I want more from Moiraine, Egwene, and Nynaeve's perspective (maybe that'll change, I dunno) but I'll survive.
I have such a crush on Moiraine from #WheelOfTime. I also read 14 chapters yesterday which is a record for anything I've read recently.
Like I'm thinking about how many food scraps I have and... none. The answer is NONE.
Bizarre thoughts of the day brought to you by random Instagram ads. https://t.co/WsthX3VOLX

RT @LaurenWalshArt: Him stay very still. https://t.co/smmccp8x6D

@QueenofCrit It wasn't the biggest deal because, like I said, I wasn't religious. I didn't really want to be there. 

But there was that distinct feeling of being an outsider despite being there with people who weren't. It was very strange.

I've been struggling for YEARS to read books only to suddenly be reminded that if I play music while I'm reading, I go from the slowest reader on the planet to a literal speedreader. 

I did this all the time when I was younger. I don't know why I stopped or when I forgot.
@march1studios Yep. I'm thrown off but I did convince my cat to let me feed her at 6am instead of 4am so for once it was to my benefit.
@QueenofCrit I was still distinctly aware of it, every time I was in a church, that despite being there and listening to the hymns and saying the prayers, I was not "one of them."

@QueenofCrit And that doesn't even take into account growing up questioning my beliefs and feeling like an outsider every time I walked into the church. Or knowing I was gay and walking into a church I knew that hated me. 

This is coming from someone who wasn't even raised religious.

@QueenofCrit The church is lonely. I grew up not being able to take communion because I wasn't baptized. So I always had to sit back in the pews while everyone else got their blessing. Even if you're there, at church, if you're not exactly like everyone else, you're not one of them.

@Aras_Sivad One day you'll get something new, it may not be a mirror but it'll be new, and it'll be YOURS. And it may not replace the mirror but you'll be able to make new memories with it, for what that's worth. 💜

@Aras_Sivad I'm sorry. I guess there's no way of getting it back? I'm sorry if that hurts to ask; I just don't know if it's a possibility maybe one day down the line. I know it hurts to lose stuff that had important value to you. And then sometimes your brain just decides to REMIND you. 😔
@tiafapodcast Oh, this is useful, thank you! Gonna keep this in mind for side of the road encounters with small mobs like wolves and the like.

@Douglas__K There is nothing wrong to me about ethical non-monogamy. There's plenty of it on that app in many different forms and good on those people! They're honest about it! Lying to me about it was not honest or ethical! That's what I was pissed about! She was cute too but no thanks. 🙃

@Douglas__K I should have said something about how they should put it in their profile but honestly, I was so put off by how they tried to have a conversation with me and then lead into the fact they were a couple like it was just a casual subject change and not a total breach of trust?
@TheYuriCanon That one even I have no idea. 😂
@TheYuriCanon Emojis. More emojis?

Anyway, I didn't respond. I unmatched with them immediately. I was not happy to be treated like that. Everyone else I've met has been very respectful and nice so this was just very strange and just... left a bitter taste in my mouth. Reminded me there are weird people out there.

Also, this wasn't like this person matched with me then asked. Like they started having a CONVERSATION with me THEN asked. I thought I was conversing with a single individual. At no point did I realize this was two people or an individual in a relationship. It was weird.

And there are plenty of couples who make it clear that they are looking for someone to hook up with or be in an open relationship with. 

There's no reason why that fact should be hidden. There's no rule on the app that says no couples sharing accounts. There's no reason to lie.

I don't care what you're into. Do as you please. Just don't drag unsuspecting strangers into YOUR wants and desires without consent. I did not consent to match with a couple so no, that is NOT okay. I am not into that. That should have been made clear to me.

Ugh, just had the weirdest experience on a dating app and it was very off-putting. 

If you're a couple, put it in your profile. Don't match with someone and be like "we're a couple, is that okay?" I should be able to hard no out of that, not be led on.

@WollenbergGaard It might be an endgame thing where like hey, prior to the final battle, here's a Pokeball for your dog. Or... just don't bring your dog to the castle. There's that plan too. I feel like a parent. 😂 They've adopted a pet, now they need to care for it.
It's ironic I'm reading a novel about a character with POTS and I'm getting fatigued from sitting up while reading said book because of my POTS.

@WollenbergGaard I'm getting a lot of suggestions of how to keep this dog alive but honestly, if my players just say they're taking care of him and keeping him out of danger, I'm of a mind to just say the dog has plot armour for most intents and purposes. They just might have to get creative.

@WollenbergGaard Intriguing but not sure how well it would fit in the campaign I'm running because I'm not sure how they'd acquire such an object. There's nowhere to buy magical items and it's not something I'd just leave conveniently lying around within like the next few sessions.
@WollenbergGaard That might be on my list one day. I know a friend who is running it though we haven't started it yet.

@NevernotDM That's not to say I'm not having fun with my group, it's just not my favourite adventure module so far in terms of writing, at least from what I've seen so far. That might change as things go on.

@NevernotDM I'm in the middle of playing it. Not a huge fan of how it feels like there's just a LOT of side quests and I'm not sure if there's really an overarching story. We seem to have come to something bigger recently but there's mostly been a lot of back and forth really.

Sometimes your players do something that's so infectiously endearing, it's all you can think about for the entire day after the session. 

That's how my day is going.

I'm so amused by my players and their enthusiasm to adopt a dog in the middle of a horror campaign. Should I have expected this? Probably. Did I? No. Am I now 110% on board with their plan to have a dog for the rest of the campaign? Yes. 

It's all I've been thinking about today.

@HippieGeekGirl I went looking for pictures of dogs that matched the description I gave him in-game and I think that's what got me... I was like oh no... I've fallen in love. He's a Good Boy and I can't say no to the party keeping him.

I went from "no, the party is not keeping this dog, I'm going to do everything in my power to offload the dog onto some NPC" to "oh no, I love Harvey, I will do everything in my power to protect Harvey from the horrors of Barovia".

Harvey even has a token, though it will probably never see the light of day on a battle map. I just wanted to be ready, should the party decide that Harvey jumps in to save the day. https://t.co/v7k4HFu4vm

I made Harvey a stat block knowing full well the party is never ever going to put a pet dog with 5HP into combat. 

But honestly, I just wanted to give him the "good boy" alignment. https://t.co/JBUFILpq20

I should have had them roll for starting gold or have done starting equipment plus additional gold to start but I wasn't thinking at the time. Oh well, now they get the chance to make some additional purchases and we'll just say they did it pre-game.

And by retconning how I did starting equipment, I mean I added to what I originally gave them, I didn't take anything away. I didn't think it was fair that a level three party was only using starting equipment considering they'd have some experience, so I have them extra gold.

Sometimes as a DM you've gotta retcon things. One of my DMs made a better call than I did during character creation for a similar party so I went back and retconned how I did starting equipment for the party. Thankfully, they're only a session in so I made the call early enough.

I didn't realize just how much brain fog my POTS caused until it went away. I forgot what it was like to have a semi-clear head. I don't know what to do with all this available brain power.
@MonarchFisher Yours actually looks better than mine does. Looks like it has more space and has a better overall design.

@MonarchFisher For what it's worth, these are normalized in North America and I've never seen them as something to look down upon. Lots of people rely on public transit and these are simply convenient for getting groceries back and forth. I have one too! It's purple! Some D&D patches maybe?
@Drgnfly42 @MonarchFisher I second this! Make it look like an adventurer's trolley of goods and loot!

And the secondary bonus is that this may help with my ADHD. It's hard when you're taking meds for ADHD and it feels like they don't work because you still have such severe brain fog, you can't focus anyway. It's hard to tell if the meds aren't working or your brain isn't.

I've tried drinking anywhere from 2-3L of water a day and it's impossible to keep up with. I've tried electrolyte powders but they're sweet and sickly when you've had 6-8 glasses a day. Salt tablets may just be my saving grace when it comes to reducing symptoms.

I experience pre-syncope when my symptoms get particularly bad but my day-to-day symptoms mainly consist of not being able to get up, stay upright (orthostatic intolerance), or being able to think clearly. So the thought that anything could improve any of that is a small miracle.

I've always described my POTS as fairly "mild" because I rarely experience syncope like some people do but I've learned over time that that's misinformation and people can still have fairly severe POTS with different symptoms. Mine are mainly fatigue and brain fog.

It's not a massive change, considering I'm still fatigued and I still spend a fair amount of time in bed or lying down, but the ability to think clearly and not feel like I'm simply in a haze all day is mind-boggling. I haven't felt like this in months, if not years.

I've only taken these new salt pills twice with a bottle of water each time and I've noticed that even though I'm still highly fatigued, I don't have the same amount of brain fog. I'm clear-headed and have an easier time thinking and focusing on things I want to do.

I should also probably invest in a home machine to check my blood pressure. My doctors have asked if I have one a couple times and I'm wondering if that might be a better way to track some of my symptoms than just "I feel terrible, let's take a stab in the dark as to why."

I've always thought of my POTS as fairly mild because I don't get full syncope or pre-syncope that often but honestly, it's all the other symptoms that affect me most often. I do get lightheaded and I get... disoriented, I guess?

I don't get a lot of pre-syncope with my POTS but I do get a lot of fatigue, weakness, and brain fog. It always feels almost like I have low blood sugar, but I know it's because I'm dehydrated. No amount of water seems to be enough. Electrolyte drinks only help so much too.

I need to start taking salt pills daily, I think, but they're $25-$30 for a bottle of 100 pills and I don't even know how many a day I need to take. 

I'm trying a new brand next month that might work better but they have to be shipped from the US. 😭

@OutiHarvey I think of all the times I try so hard to be "normal" and make my body do things the way it should and not the way it can and how disappointed I am when it doesn't go the way I want it to. It's hard to accept that I can't keep up with others my age or that I have limitations.

@OutiHarvey I know. My doctors (two of them now) have told me not to be so hard on myself. That I'm trying my best and that this is not my fault. It's not less of me to have to live my life differently than other people. It just feels like such a let down, you know? Like I'm missing out.

There's no point to this thread really. Just putting words to my feelings and thoughts. 

A changing disability is hard. The last few years have been hard which has probably contributed significantly.

I'm just hoping there are steps I can take to make things a little better.

I've been fairly lucky that my POTS symptoms are moderate. My (likely) EDS/HSD symptoms have been relatively mild for most of my life. 

But I feel like that is changing as I get older and that's a lot to cope with. 

I'm disabled and I am okay with that. But disability changes.

I feel like my body is betraying me. Like if I'd done better at gym class when I was younger or exercised more now, maybe my legs wouldn't be giving out on me.

If I wasn't so fatigued, I'd have better healthy habits. 

I blame myself and it's a hard thing not to spiral into.

I used a cane throughout my entire trip to the UK in 2019 and I wouldn't have managed without it. 

So I know I need something. I know every time I leave the house without something, I'm making things harder on myself for no reason at all. 

But it's a struggle I still face.

I think the biggest obstacle would be getting over my embarrassment about using a more noticeable mobility aid. Even with a cane, I feel like I'm too young, like people will think I'm faking and I don't need it. 

I know it's internalized ableism but it's so hard to shake.

A rollator is more supportive than a cane and still has a seat I could use when I need to sit. I can still walk since the pain isn't too bad, so it seems like a decent compromise. 

I wonder if bringing it up with a doctor might be worth it. I don't know if I could get coverage.

A wheelchair would help but it would ultimately make my world more inaccessible. I take public transit and buses aren't exactly wheelchair friendly.

I think my dreams are a more extreme version of telling me I need to do something though to get out more and get around.

I really struggle with walking these days. My legs hurt, they feel weak, I'm so easily fatigued, and a cane provides some support but I can't sit down when I need to which is fairly often now. 

I'm going to bring this up at my EDS clinic appointment when discussing treatment.

Pretty sure there are only two clinics in all of Canada? Something like that.

Bottom line is... I'm still waiting to see an EDS specialist and with COVID, I don't know how long that's going to take. The waitlist was two years BEFORE the pandemic. Could be another year at this point. I have no idea.

I wish there was more than one clinic.

If it doesn't, maybe I go back. But it's a blood test that involves me having to get my blood taken at like 7am and let's be real, for someone with fatigue, that's a lot to ask. But maybe I should get it rechecked anyway. I'm still debating it.

There was one blood test he suggested possibly doing again that I haven't had done since 2019 and at the time, I wasn't confident it wouldn't just come back again as normal... but I might ask my family doctor to order it, just in case. If it comes back as normal, that's that.

He reassured me that his priority was making sure I've had the right testing and I've been given the right referrals and nothing has been skipped or looked over. He's confident that no one has missed anything for me and the next step is seeing this specialist. So I'm glad.

And I told him I felt like this was all a personal failing, that I wasn't doing enough. He said that it was okay if I have to live my life at a different pace than other people. That it wasn't my fault and this clinic will have people who know more ways to cope with that.

He was genuinely a really nice doctor. He listened. He took my frustration with my health seriously. He said I could follow up with him any time if I needed to, though there isn't much else he can offer at this time other than to recommend pursuing this clinic referral.

The doctor I saw can't diagnose EDS himself. He's not qualified, though he knows enough about it to say he truly believes I have it. I was referred in 2020 to the EDS clinic in Toronto and still have an active referral to see a specialist. So his recommendation was to follow up.

There are so many things I do that I know are because of my ADHD but they have nothing to do with my attention span or whether or not I can focus. 

It affects my executive function, my memory, my processing, everything. 

So why is it "Can't Sit Still Disorder"?

Because walking past a container of icing for three months straight and continually forgetting it needed to go in the garbage because it was in the "wrong room" is an ADHD problem but it's not exactly an attention regulation problem.
It really should be renamed to something that encompasses more of the executive functioning dysfunction and not just my lack of attention regulation.

I could not begin to explain to you why this was such an issue. 

Well, I could but it makes so little sense even to me that it's borderline embarrassing. 

Except that it's finally in the kitchen so when the garbage goes out, so will the darn container.
ADHD: Taking three months to move a container of cake icing 20ft from my bedroom to the kitchen so I'll remember to throw it out when I take the kitchen garbage out to the chute.

I was fully willing to take the Pfizer today under medical supervision, if that was what was recommended, but they gave me the option not to so I did what felt safest for me.

I truly appreciate the excellent care this clinic has given me the three times I have been there.

@sweetlilrima Yeah, here it's a mash up of doctors doing vaccinations (usually only for highest risk folks who can't go someplace more public), pharmacies, and then big mass vaccination clinics in like convention centres and places like that. But it's Canada and we have a huge population.

@sweetlilrima But it's also why you'll see Canadians saying we have both Pfizer/Moderna vaccination status! Health Canada approved full vaccination status for anyone who has two shots of any combination of the two which I think is unique to us.

@sweetlilrima Canada had major supply problems at the start. So the wait times for pharmacies offering the choice is ridiculously long because of how they have to go by supply for each. It's easier to get an appointment at a clinic where you'll just take whatever you're given.

@sweetlilrima I could have booked at a private pharmacy for the choice but it would have been months out and I also know the health unit run clinics took really good care of me when I had my reaction so I'm not too concerned!

@sweetlilrima Now we have both so some pharmacies are allowing choice for the booster but mass vaccination clinics are going by supply. I'm closer to a mass clinic and it was easier to get an appointment so I get what I get.

@sweetlilrima We don't really get to choose either necessarily. It's mostly based on supply. In Canada, Pfizer and Moderna are considered interchangeable so I got Pfizer first because that's all we had and then Moderna second because it's all we had.

The mass vaccination clinic doesn't let you choose so I could be given either Pfizer (which I had a bad reaction to) or Moderna (which I had no reaction to) and I'm sitting here kind of anxious because I don't know either way.

I have to go get my booster shot today which means eating a bigger breakfast + making sure I take all my morning meds + making sure I'm extra hydrated + taking salt supplements so I don't have a potential reaction to the vaccine because I don't know which one they're giving me.

@LeighTeetzel My guess then is he's probably just getting used to the space and he's probably just communicating with you. It's the calmest time of day (for him) to come out and interact on his terms. Unfortunately, it's also your sleep time. He'll learn daytime is the time to come out.

@LeighTeetzel If he seems most chill in the evenings, that may be the best time to leave some food out for him, let him come out to have a snack and explore as he gets more comfortable. He may be meowing from stress but might want something? I feed Yasha at like 10pm to reduce night meowing.

@LeighTeetzel He also may just be a night vocal cat. If that's the case then you really don't want to encourage it. 

- from the owner of a night vocal cat

@LeighTeetzel You know he's in a safe space, he just needs to learn that he's in a safe space too. Sometimes that just means leaving them alone and doing your thing for awhile. You just don't want to get him too used to having you come running whenever he's crying at night or he'll continue.

@LeighTeetzel Try coaxing him out during the day and giving him the most attention when you're awake. You still need to sleep. He'll learn your routine as long as you stick to it. Part of introducing a new pet is also not disrupting your own routine too much.

@LeighTeetzel Actually, not responding to the cat might be a good idea. Let him meow it out if it's how he's coping but don't enable the habit. Yasha likes to try attention-seeking behaviour like meowing or knocking things over at night and the more I ignore it, the less she does it.

@gaea_ca I've been in this other group for awhile. I've noticed the difference between the two for awhile. I would be excited for one while just mildly okay about the other. I was lonely because of the pandemic and D&D was filling the void but I'm realizing there weren't enough positives.

I have a better group to play in and one where my energy while playing is noticeably different. I actually have fun and look forward to sessions because I enjoy them, not because I feel like I need them to get through the week.

@Alacrity17 There was a toxic player in my group but no one was willing to stand up to it so... 🤷🏻‍♀️ But there were other reasons too. Group was too big, spotlight wasn't being shared, relationships weren't being allowed to grow, players weren't making an effort to get to know other PCs.

I should have left months ago when my gut first told me this wasn't the game for me anymore. I didn't want to feel left out. Two of my best friends play in that game. I wanted to spend time with them. 

Instead, I made myself miserable.

Leaving a D&D game you didn't feel comfortable in sucks, especially under regrettable circumstances, but it didn't really hit me until after I left just how many ways I wasn't happy or having fun anymore. I stuck around for a fictional character that I can play anywhere.

@sweetlilrima The costumes are stunning. The music is amazing. The cinematography makes me swoon. Some of the CGI is funny but I feel like that gives it charm. It's like being transported to another world when I watch it. I streamed it for a friend and she couldn't wait to watch more.
@sweetlilrima *what this is

@sweetlilrima I definitely understand it's not for everyone but it'll always have a special place in my heart. It came up on my Netflix recommendations with the preview shot of LWJ holding up a bleeding WWX in the rain and I was like... I HAVE to know what this. Watched it in a week.

@Itsjustbeej That's so annoying. I hate that retailers save my email without me having an account with them. Like I get enough spam without the constant reminders for items I don't intend to buy. If I didn't check out, odds are I couldn't afford shipping or I changed my mind.

@sweetlilrima And I was actually more appreciative of CQL because of the format of Chinese dramas and how they fit into a set number of episodes, unlike American dramas that write for a season and hope to get renewed and adapt further. We got the full story AND it was done well.

@sweetlilrima When I learned the differences between MDZS and CQL, I was actually really appreciative of how tightly knit they made the story while still keeping the main themes and relationships. It's a huge novel, condensing it into 50 episodes is not an easy feat. Adaptions are hard to do!

@Itsjustbeej @cavaticat Okay, I find it creepy enough to get checkout reminder emails from putting my email in once to get a shipping estimate. Getting a PHONE CALL? 

Absolutely not.

@sweetlilrima I'm just as excited to read the new official English translation of the novel but I'll also be waiting months between books and can't binge the same way I binged CQL. Different experiences? No better, no worse. 🤷🏻‍♀️ I have never seen the point in fighting.

@sweetlilrima I click best with CQL because I'm a visual person. I have a background in TV and film. It's an absolutely fantastic adaption. The novel was hard for me to get into because it's so long but CQL is just so visually engaging and captivating. Doesn't make it better, just different.

@chelle_katz Should take a couple of days! These are meant to be worn more often than my other pair so I'll get used to the fact I have to actually tilt my head more than just shifting my eyes when I want to look down. Got out of the habit when I got wider glasses, I guess, haha.
@chelle_katz I don't have much depth perception at the best of times, it's ten times worse when I suddenly feel like I'm three feet taller.
@chelle_katz So, of course, stairs are always the worst hazard with new glasses.

@chelle_katz It's always when I'm standing too and I look down at the floor without tilting my entire head so I catch the reading part of my glasses, not the distance, and suddenly I have the perspective of a super tall person who is very far away from her own feet and I'm like NOPE.
If I look down too far without tilting my whole head, my perspective shifts so I suddenly feel really tall and far away from the floor. It's actually super unnerving and off-balancing.

Getting used to new glasses is always wonky. This is the same prescription but the shape of these frames is different so the transition from where my lenses go from distance to reading is in a different spot. If I look down at just the right angle, my perspective goes weird.

This does not apply to regular commissioned work. When I do commissions for strangers, I expect to be paid in cash either upfront or on whatever schedule we've agreed to. But when it comes to friends, there are lots of other ways to show you value my work, not just my discount.

When it comes to working for friends, I accept tips in the form of actual cash but also coffee dates, groceries or pre-cooked meals, help with chores, small gifts, art trades, etc. Whatever you're able to do to show you do appreciate my work. It means a lot to me.

I don't do a lot of commissioned work these days and when I do, it's almost exclusively for friends. This means I'm working almost entirely at a discount or for free (because I've offered to). If you can afford to tip me for my work, I do appreciate it.

Absolutely this. If you're a friend of mine, I am happy to try and help work around your budget when it comes to commissioned work. But if you're doing it because you don't really value the time or effort I put into the work I do for you, then you're not a friend after all. https://t.co/NIWlXvSLHk

I'm going to talk to my doctor again. I don't know why I was never diagnosed. I did all the tests and sleep studies to rule out any other existing conditions. I just want answers. Even if there's nothing anyone can do... I just want someone to tell me it's not in my head.

And it's more than being exhausted. It's bone-crushingly exhausted. It's doing one chore and feeling wiped out for days. It's feeling like I have no energy left in my entire being. It's soul-destroying. I'm so exhausted, I feel like I can't keep up with anyone or anything, ever.

I really need to get an ME/CFS diagnosis. I know my doctors have considered it but not diagnosed it because they didn't think it would make a difference. But it would make a difference to me. I'm tired of being exhausted and feeling like it's a character flaw.

I dunno where I'm going with this. I guess there's just such a focus on reopening and going 'back to normal', I wonder when anyone is going to start talking about the fact our lives are just different now. We've all been on hold for two years... maybe more. Then what?

It's kind of like I'm on hold while I wait for the world to be fixed. And that carries over to even the most basic of tasks. Dishes? On hold. Vacuuming? On hold. It's just hard to get out of that holding pattern. Even when I don't go anywhere, my home is stuck in that pattern.

And I don't just mean masking, social distancing, vaccines, etc. Our routines have been changed. The way we view our homes has changed. Just going out more isn't going to fix the fact that our lives have been turned upside down by all of this and we're all, frankly, exhausted.

I don't think the solution is just to make the outside world go back to 'normal' and just get out more. I feel like we're all gonna have to learn to cope with the massive amount of stress we've been under for the past nearly two years. It's changed how we live our lives.

2020 and 2021 have stressed my ADHD brain out so much that I am still tackling an endless pile of dishes in my kitchen with seemingly no end in sight.

@MorganMorrow333 No problem! There's whole lists out there with recommendations for other oils and their uses. I know people who swear by them. They're not my thing but I don't discount them if they work for others.

@MorganMorrow333 You have a really narrow window right at the beginning of a migraine to catch it, that's why. I don't get migraine auras so I don't get a warning and I oftentimes miss the window. If you do get an aura, you're usually better off for timing since most people will take meds then.

@MorganMorrow333 I believe it was peppermint that's good for headaches. You can apply a dab of diluted oil to each of your temples during a migraine attack and the menthol is really supposed to help. I tried it when I was younger with okay results. Just be careful around pets though.

@MorganMorrow333 You might be able to ask for a stronger prescription of over the counter meds if treating headaches that way isn't working for you too. I have an Rx for Naproxen to treat headaches when I get them that's stronger than what's available OTC. No side effects, just a higher dosage.

@MorganMorrow333 —counter-intuitive for people who are scent sensitive) but there are some essential oils that are very good for headaches. Assuming you can run a diffuser or use diffusing jewelry safely (they can be unsafe for pets). I tend to go straight for medication personally. 😅

@MorganMorrow333 I could basically no longer function because of my migraines so if you're ever at that point, I recommend giving it another shot. If you don't think that's for you then over the counter meds may be an option or trying things like teas or aromatherapy (I know that's—

@MorganMorrow333 I get that but I was at the point of nothing else being an option. I got lucky and my first medication working perfectly. In other situations, I've definitely been there though and have been through 3-5 meds before finding one that worked. I think it depends on what you need.
@MorganMorrow333 I take preventative migraine medication. Whatever the cause of my migraines, it's the only thing that helps for me. Went from having 3-4 a week to maybe 1-2 a month if that.

@rderekp All my measuring cups and spoons are marked in both metric and imperial so I can follow any recipe I print off online using either system without having to convert either way. (The only thing I'd have to check is the oven temp and make sure it's in Fahrenheit.)

@rderekp For example: my stove is in Fahrenheit because that's how it's programmed as it was manufactured in the US. Same with my thermostat. But the thermometres I use around my apartment to measure the temperature in rooms or outdoors are in Celsius because that's what I'm used to.

@rderekp I'm not gonna lie, I use feet/inches more often than I use metric measurements on a day-to-day basis. I'm so oversaturated by American measurements on websites and various resources, that it's become second nature. Same with certain instances of Celsius vs. Fahrenheit.

@rderekp Yeah, most Canadians don't switch anyway because we're effectively bilingual in metric/imperial units! We use them interchangeably in real life fairly often so you won't see us too confused by seeing feet in a game. It was more seeing metric in a 5e context that was just odd!
I decided to change my name to "Galey the Ghoul" this year as my Spooky Name™  to try to avoid any confusion but, let's be real, "Ghouley" is too good of a pun not too use so I switched back.

@rderekp Some people change it but not a lot of people do. If a square is 5ft, then a square is 5ft. Easy enough to just count by fives on a grid to get an idea of how far 30ft is. No real need to convert it.

@rderekp I'm a non-American who converts to "American" all the time. It's just brain-boggling when you suddenly see your own units of measurement in a system based off of an American system. I wasn't saying anything ever needed to be changed or that I ever changed anything to begin with.

@rderekp Nothing does. It's just strange to get used to because 5e doesn't use the metric system and this system is almost entirely 5e-based so it's just odd to see the metric system in use. Nothing needs to be changed.
@rderekp Also, I've literally never done that. I've always played in 5ft intervals because that's just how the book and maps read. I have zero problems just associating a square on a map with 5ft.
@rderekp But... 2m is not 5ft, it's 6.5ft.
I'm making a character sheet for a 5e-based TTRPG system that uses metres. After playing so much standard D&D 5e, it absolutely breaks my brain, even as someone who actually uses the metric system.
